Theorem 4.16. The determinant of a matrix A ∈Rn×n is the product of
its eigenvalues, i.e.,
det(A) =
n∏
i=1
λi, (4.42)
where λi are (possibly repeated) eigenvalues of A.
Draft (2019-10-15) of “Mathematics for Machine Learning”. Feedback:https://mml-book.com.
